metadata.Title: CVE-2018-16873 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description: In Go before 1.10.6 and 1.11.x before 1.11.3, the "go get" command is vulnerable to remote code execution when executed with the -u flag and the import path of a malicious Go package, or a package that imports it directly or indirectly. Specifically, it is only vulnerable in GOPATH mode, but not in module mode (the distinction is documented at https://golang.org/cmd/go/#hdr-Module_aware_go_get). Using custom domains, it's possible to arrange things so that a Git repository is cloned to a folder named ".git" by using a vanity import path that ends with "/.git". If the Git repository root contains a "HEAD" file, a "config" file, an "objects" directory, a "refs" directory, with some work to ensure the proper ordering of operations, "go get -u" can be tricked into considering the parent directory as a repository root, and running Git commands on it. That will use the "config" file in the original Git repository root for its configuration, and if that config file contains malicious commands, they will execute on the system running "go get -u".

notes.Note: mdeslaur> Packages built using golang need to be rebuilt once the vulnerability has been fixed. This CVE entry does not list packages that need rebuilding outside of the main repository or the Ubuntu variants with PPA overlays.

criterions.comment: golang-1.10: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
golang-1.8: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
golang-1.9: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
